description.narrative:
Sida stödjer den 13: e dokumentärfilmsfestivalen DocuDAYS.UA Human Rights Film Festival *Beyond Illusions* planerad till 25 mars - 1 april 2016. Festivalen är helt i linje med den svenska regeringens regionala resultatstrategi för Ukraina 2014-2020. Festivalen kompletterar och ger synlighet till annat Sidafinanseriat stöd inom området för mänskliga rättigheter i Ukraina. Efter att ha bidragit med en plattform för en MR-fokuserad samhälls-dialog, initialt i Kiev, kommer DocuDAYS Festival besökal mer än hundra ukrainska städer och byar för att nå en publik på mer än 100 000 personer. Festivalen kommer att omfatta diskussioner, petitioner, seminarier, rundabordssamtal, press-konferenser, master classes. Bidraget har alltså ett interaktivt format, mycket lämplig för policydialog i linje med Sidas verksamhet. Den samlade riskbedömningen visar både låg och medelhög risk för bidraget. Standardrisker är medelhöga. Sidas upphandlingsregler ska användas. NGO South har påbörjat ett internt utvecklingsarbete och kommer att göra en årlig revision. Ambassaden planerar att låta göra en uppföljning av det treåriga samarbetet med arrangörerna av DOCUDAYS UA vid slutförandet av bidrag 55070079.
Undantag från insatsregeln: organisationen ska placera finansiella medel på ett icke-räntebärande konto, då det för närvarande inte finns förutsättningar i Ukrainas lagstiftning för att enskilda organisationer ska kunna placera medel på ett räntebärande konto och sedan skicka ränta tillbaka till givare.
Aktivitetsperioden är 01.01.2015 - 31.12.2016. Avtalsperioden är 01.01.2015 - 30.06.2017.
************* Sida supports the 13th DocudaysUA Human Rights Documentary Film Festival *Beyond Illusions* scheduled for March 25 - April 1, 2016. The festival is fully in line with the Swedish Government Regional Results Strategy for Ukraine 2014-2020. The festival complements and gives visibility to other work by Sida in the area of human rights in Ukraine.
After providing a platform for a HR-focused societal dialogue, initially held in Kyiv in March 2016, the DocudaysUA Festival with travel throughout Ukraine to over a hundred Ukrainain cities and villages to engage with an 100 000-wide audience throughout the country. The festival will include discussions, petitions, seminars, round tables, press-conferences, master classes. The contribution has, therefore, an interactive format, very suitable for delivering policy messages in line with Sida’s work.
The overall risk assessment shows both low and medium risks for the contribution. The standard risks for the intervention which is running for the 13th time are medium high. Sida's procurement rules will be used. NGO South has started and sustained its audit history. The Embassy of Sweden is awaiting an audit of the third year of development cooperation with the organisers of the DocudaysUA at the completion of Contribution 55070079.
The exception from the Contribution Management Rule: The financing provided by Sida shall be deposited by the organization on a noninterest bearing account, as there are at the moment no legal provisions in Ukraine for nongovernmental organizations to place funds on an interest bearing account and send the interest income back to the sponsor.
The activity period is 01.01.2015 - 31.12.2016. The agreement period is 01.01.2015 - 30.06.2017.
The contribution finances the Human Rights Film Festival which starts in spring in Kyiv and then travels to 180 towns/cities to demonstrate the HR films to 40 000 citizens of Ukraine
Ukrainian society is better aware of human rights and universal values enshrined in international HR conventions

description.narrative: The 13th edition of the International Human Rights Documentary Festival Docudays UA took place in 2016. Events of the 13th Docudays U? Festival were united by a theme ‘Beyond Illusions’. The topic has been chosen since after the Maidan protests the feeling that human kind is making its way through illusions to some new kind of civilization was growing stronger. Illusion of stability of the system created on agreements between democratic states, has been undermined. Illusion persistent in the world that Ukraine was a weak country and Ukrainians were unable to organise themselves was also undermined. Illusions about international institutions and the UN, set up to secure peace, order, protection of human rights and oppose aggression in the world have vanished too. At the same time, freedom of spirit and self-organisation of Ukrainians inspired and called to action! These people are changing not only themselves and their country, but the whole contemporary civilizational order. During the 13th Travelling Human Rights Documentary Film Festival Docudays_UA in Kyiv, the organizers tried to cast a look BEYOND ILLUSIONS together with directors, human rights activists and experts from different countries, representatives of Ukrainian authorities, and protesters from Maidan. During the events in Ukraine in October – December 2016 the Travelling Human Rights Documentary Film Festival Docudays UA gathered 111 234 viewers, who were involved into this large-scale campaign in 238 cities and towns in 23 regions in Ukraine, including Luhansk and Donetsk regions and the Autonomous Republic of Crimea.
